page.title: 17Nesley Farm:Near Beverstone.
page.content: Nesley Farm is composed of nearly 600 acres of land.125 acres are open grassland for sheep.No silage is made but some of the crop is cut for hay. The main crops are cereals,winter wheat,barley,spring wheat and spring barley.Most of the sheep are crossbreds:the Clun Forest from Salop and the Suffolk Purebred.They also have 660 ewes to use for breeding.They have 15 rams at the moment but they hope to buy another 5.So far this year,eight ewes have had quads.The price of a lamb is high this year(up to Â£38).The farmer is being offered a low price for his barley(Â£105 per ton).He has no intention of growing any other crops this year.
